article_title: Airport Shooting Renews Debate on Armed Officers
article_text:
LOS ANGELES—Roughly a year before the fatal shooting rampage at Los Angeles International Airport, federal security officials turned away a request by the head of the local airport-police union to ensure armed security was posted around screening checkpoints.

The request highlighted a debate that has been reignited by Friday's shooting: Whether armed officers should be present at airport security-screening stations nationwide. Such an...

twitter.description: The shooting rampage at Los Angeles International Airport renewed a debate on whether armed officers should be present at security-screening stations. Such an armed presence was commonplace after the 2001 terrorist attacks.
twitter.creator: @jacknicas

article_summary:
The request highlighted a debate that has been reignited by Friday's shooting: Whether armed officers should be present at airport security-screening stations nationwide.
LOS ANGELES—Roughly a year before the fatal shooting rampage at Los Angeles International Airport, federal security officials turned away a request by the head of the local airport-police union to ensure armed security was posted around screening checkpoints.
